meanings.definition: To experience again, as a past event.
meanings.sent1: I relive my childhood memories when I look at old photographs.
meanings.sent2: She likes to relive her favorite moments by watching home videos.
meanings.sent3: Every time he sees his old toys, he can't help but relive the joy of playing with them.
meanings.sent4: The smell of fresh cookies baking in the oven made her relive the warmth of her grandmother's kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the ocean waves crashing against the shore helped him relive his peaceful beach vacation.

meanings.definition: To live through again, as a memory or feeling.
meanings.sent1: After watching the movie, she couldn't help but relive the emotions of the main character.
meanings.sent2: He often relives the excitement of his first baseball game in his mind.
meanings.sent3: The old song made her relive the heartbreak she felt when it first played.
meanings.sent4: The smell of fresh flowers in the garden made her relive the happiness of her wedding day.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the homemade pie made him relive the comfort of his mother's cooking.
